text: The sheer amount of content and depth within this game is truly astounding. And somehow, absolutely none of it is in the least bit boring or tedious. This game truly is a masterpiece. Also yoyos are amazing.
author: Moop Bread

text: Until you get to the lunar "events". Which are boring and tedious as hell. Before that, however, the game is one of my all-time favourites. I guess that they had to put in a repeatable "end-game" for those who want to farm items they'll never have a use for, but frankly I always stop playing once I reach the events. Grinding for grinding sake.
author: k9wazere

text: Looks like Zangarmarsh from World of Warcraft.
author: The PC Elitist

text: Every time I hear that squeak in the beginning, I expect baby Mario to start floating away, crying.
author: WimpyMcWeaksauce

text: this is a cool song. reminds me of a lot of games at once

text: You pick the best music dude. Everytime I see you in my subscription feed it's a song that I love.

text: Feels like I'm getting high just listening to this.

text: One of my favorites from the soundtrack! I linger in the mushroom biomes just to hear the bass and leads! Plantera is also a badass track!

text: I havent played this game in a while, but they keep updating it that i should.

text: It's disjointed feeling is kinda like listening to an EarthBound song, don't you think?
author: Medal Melodies

text: Yeah I could definitely hear this in a new Earthbound game, when fighting mushroom/plant enemies. It could even use Mother 3's rhythm battle system, it'd be pretty hard to tap along this track's beat!
author: SupraDarky

text: Played this game's iPad version for a bit... Kind of buggy at a few points, but it's still fun. I prefer Minecraft when it comes to sandbox games, though.
author: Jirt

text: You should never play any version of Terraria that isn't the PC one.
author: RascalTC

text: This is interesting to listen to.  It has that techno pop kind of sound.  It is really unique to listen to.
author: Eric C.

text: Hell yes. I love this game and this music.
author: RhanC777

text: They need to make a mushroom boss sometime.
author: Sephiko

text: I wasn't too sure about this track when I first listened to it (aptly titled, btw), but I found myself going for a 2nd a listen, then a 3rd... It's very disjointed on purpose, but it still creates a surprisingly interesting, complex and memorable little theme.
author: SupraDarky

text: Excellent choice. I made myself a mushroom biome just so I could hear this whenever I was in my home.
